explanation: Agent A is correct: the function calls the unescape_callback with c->rq.hdrs.rq_line.rq_tgt but there is no unconditional guarantee in the shown code that that buffer is NUL-terminated. The only explicit NUL write in this function is rq_tgt_qmark[0] = 0 which is executed only when a '?' is present; otherwise termination is only asserted via mhd_assert(strlen(...) == ...). Those asserts are debug-only and may be compiled out. The code therefore may pass a non-NUL-terminated char * to a callback that (as is plausible) uses string.h functions such as strlen/strcpy/memcpy; such uses would then risk accessing beyond the bounds of the object. MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 forbids such potential out-of-bounds accesses by string.h routines. Absent an external, unconditional guarantee (not present in the snippet) that rq_tgt is NUL-terminated or the buffer is safely padded with a NUL, this is a violation (or at least a definite potential violation) of Rule 21.17.
